page.title: 10THE LIFE OF A HOUESWIFE.
page.content: Life in Marston Magna can be very pleasant for a housewife. There are some very attractive and quite new houses with large gardens set back from the main road, making for a peaceful life.The only disturbance being the aeroplanes flying overhead. Although there are no shops in the village this does not appear to cause too many problems as most families own a car and travel to Yeovil for food, clothing and any other requirements. After the wives have completed their houeswork there are many hobbies which they like to pursue such as gardening, sewing, patchwork or jam making. The Woman's Institute is a favourite with many of the ladies as here they can meet their friends and catch up with all the village news, listen to speakers and take part in various competitions.
